intro: Trichospermum discolor, commonly known as the variegated coral tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with white or yellow variegation and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds surrounded by a fleshy, red aril. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental species in gardens. Trichospermum discolor is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
